Model Initial Values

Model Initial Values contains any model's intial values you add. Model initial values define the initial values for the corresponding inports of model(s) in a system definition file.

What do you want to do?

Add model(s)

To add model(s), click the Add Model(s) button. You also can right-click Model Initial Values in the configuration tree and select Add Model(s) from the shortcut menu.

Add inport(s) initial values for a model

To add inport(s), click the Add Inport(s) button. You also can right-click the Model in the configuration tree under Model Initial Values and select Add Inport(s) from the shortcut menu.

Export model(s) initial values to a text file

To export model(s) initial values to a text file, click the Export button. You also can right-click Model Initial Values in the configuration tree and select Export from the shortcut menu.

Import model(s) initial values from a text file

To import model(s) inital values from a text file, click the Import button. You also can right-click Model Initial Values in the configuration tree and select Import from the shortcut menu.

Remove model(s)

To remove a single model, select the model name in the configuration tree and click the red X button. You also can right-click the model name in the configuration tree and select Remove Model from the shortcut menu.

To remove multiple models, select the Model Initial Values custom device in the configuration tree and click Remove Model(s). You also can right-click the Model Initial Values custom device in the configuration tree and select Remove Model(s) from the shortcut menu.

Remove inport(s) initial values for a model

To remove inport(s), click the Remove Inport(s) button. You also can right-click Model in the configuration tree under Model Initial Values and select Remove Inport(s) from the shortcut menu.

View or change a model's initial values

To view or change a model's initial values, select the model name in the configuration tree. The Model Configuration page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about creating models, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
